prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a long, thin, rectangular object with a slightly curved top edge.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Next, create a sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Begin by drawing line 1 from the point (0.0, 0.0577) to (0.0003, 0.0191). Follow this by drawing line 2 from (0.0003, 0.0191) to (0.0339, 0.0). Then, draw line 3 from (0.0339, 0.0) to (0.0673, 0.0196). Afterthat, draw line 4 from (0.0673, 0.0196) to (0.067, 0.0582). Draw line 5 from (0.067, 0.0582) to (0.0333, 0.0773). Lastly, draw line 6 from (0.0333, 0.0773) to (0.0, 0.0577). Now, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.0773 using the sketch_scale parameter. Next, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.75 units, resulting in a 3D model of the part. **Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [89.5742, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0001, 0.0495, 0.0391]. First, create a sketch on the XZ plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle centered at (0.011, 0.011) with a radius of 0.011 units. This will form the top part of the cylindrical object. Next, draw another circle centered at (0.011, 0.6607) with a radius of 0.011 units on the XZ plane of the coordinate system. This will form the bottom part of the cylindrical object. Now, scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6718 using the sketch_scale parameter. Next, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Then, extrude the 2D sketch along the negative Z direction by a depth of 0.067 units, creating a rectangular hole at the center of the cylindrical object. Finally, use the CutFeatureOperation to remove the extruded hole, leaving the final shape of the part. Note: The length of part 1 is 0.0773, the width is 0.0773, and the height is 0.75. The length of part 2 is 0.072, the width is 0.672, and the height is 0.672. The final shape is a long, rectangular, metallic object with a slightly tapered end. The length is 0.74, the width is 0.672, and the height is 0.75.</description>
